data.title: Ethereum Cat Herders
data.description:
Ethereum Cat Herders have been supporting Ethereum Protocol development and process improvement [since 2019](https://medium.com/ethereum-cat-herders/decentralizing-ethereum-project-management-ffff4c09d0ea). Our role is to facilitate communication, collaboration, community engagement, and provide content to make informed decision for network upgrades. We are vital in coordinating and streamlining the Ethereum [protocol standard process](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxpLrRIkDlBjDUUrGgF91pQw), acting as facilitators and mediators among developers, researchers, and community members. Together with core developers and EIP authors, we actively engage in network upgrades, ensuring the smooth implementation of proposed improvements and enhancements to the Ethereum ecosystem.

By funding the Ethereum Cat Herders, Octant funds directly support our initiatives, including creating educational content, funding EIP Editors, developing and maintaining bots for the EIPs GitHub repository, and documenting Ethereum's public meeting notes. These efforts contribute to the dissemination of knowledge, efficient management of proposals, and transparent decision-making processes within the Ethereum ecosystem. Our educational resources, such as the [PEEPanEIP](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F) & [Ecosystem Project Demo](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs)  video playlist, provide accessible and comprehensive explanations of important proposals, fostering a greater understanding of the technical aspects and implications of the [Ethereum network upgrades](https://www.ethcatherders.com/upgrades).
data.problem:
The Ethereum ecosystem faces critical gaps in awareness, including the lack of easily understandable (ELI5) content related to Ethereum protocol updates, insufficient process information and documentation, and a lack of clear points of contact for EIP-related queries. 

Additionally, there is a notable deficiency in accessible information for individuals interested in contributing to Ethereum at both the protocol and non-technical levels. 

These issues collectively hinder the broader community's ability to engage with, understand, and contribute to the ongoing development of the Ethereum network.
data.solution:
The Ethereum Cat Herders (ECH) tackle these challenges by implementing several initiatives beyond just creating [developer meeting notes](https://github.com/ethereum/pm). ECH produces and curates ELI5 (Explain Like I’m 5) content like [PEEPanEIP](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F) & [Ecosystem Project Demo](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs) that simplifies complex protocol updates, making them accessible to a broader audience. We also work on improving [process documentation](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1) and ensuring that it is up-to-date, comprehensive, and easily navigable, which helps community members understand how Ethereum governance and development processes work.

To address the lack of a clear point of contact for EIP-related questions, ECH has established a dedicated support system - [EIP Editing Office Hour](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqnDHxOyuwMpyt5s8F8gdmO), inviting community engagement through [Discord channel](https://dsc.gg/ech), where individuals can ask questions and get guidance on EIP processes. 

Moreover, ECH actively promotes opportunities for both technical and non-technical contributions to the Ethereum ecosystem by creating and distributing resources that guide newcomers on how they can [get involved](https://www.ethcatherders.com/join), whether through coding, documentation, community building, or other forms of participation. 

These efforts by ECH help bridge the knowledge gap within the Ethereum community, foster greater participation, and ensure that more people can contribute effectively to the ongoing evolution of the Ethereum protocol.
data.missionSummary: The [Ethereum Cat Herders (ECH)](https://www.ethcatherders.com) are here to make Ethereum easier to understand and more accessible to everyone. Our mission is to help people learn about the Ethereum protocol, guide them through the EIP process, and encourage both technical and non-technical contributions. We create clear and simple content, provide helpful resources, and support the community to ensure everyone can take part in building and improving Ethereum.
data.businessModel: Make educational content with ecosystem grants.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Aggregation of Web3 grants news and events

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation: At The Ethereum Cat Herders, we support the continued engagement of EIP editors by providing financial assistance and resources to sustain their essential work in reviewing and refining proposals. To broaden participation, we offer bounties for new contributors and note-takers for public meetings, such as core dev calls, ensuring their valuable contributions receive visibility. We also assist new authors in navigating the EIP process and manage the editorial workflow to enhance the quality and efficiency of Ethereum’s development. Our efforts aim to strengthen the Ethereum community by recognizing and supporting both established and emerging contributors. While we do not provide direct financial support, we do build community and opportunities for new voices to join the ecosystem through initiatives like WiEP - Women in Ethereum Protocol.

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Our project adds value to the Web3 grants ecosystem by broadening participation, facilitating onboarding, and building a community focused on public goods and open-sourced technology. We enhance the visibility of both impactful projects and new perspectives as we expand the definition of what it means to be part of our ecosystem. By creating spaces for diverse voices, supporting essential roles that fuel Ethereum's innovation engine, and providing incentives for active participation, we contribute to the grant ecosystem by continuously highlighting and amplifying the best outputs within the space and incentivizing people to contribute to making educational resources for all to benefit from.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within Web3 grants. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation:
Pooja Ranjan has a strong track record in curating and sharing news related to Web3 grants and public goods. Her involvement in various community-driven projects and her role in managing and promoting events enable her to effectively aggregate and communicate relevant updates. Pooja’s expertise includes organizing and publicizing events, tracking funding opportunities, and highlighting impactful projects and initiatives. Her work ensures that critical information reaches stakeholders and fosters engagement within the Web3 grants space. She has been using her voice to amplify public goods projects, opportunities for individuals to get involved in the ecosystem, job opportunities, and funding sources for public goods in the past and would love to continue to do so into the future. 


Our team is adept at consolidating and disseminating information related to Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) and ecosystem developments. We manage and streamline communication channels that provide updates on proposals, community events, and key milestones within the Ethereum network. Our role involves understanding many diverse sources of information and ensuring that the community stays informed about significant updates, funding opportunities, and project developments. We also network to gather insights and share news relevant to Ethereum and its broader Web3 ecosystem.

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation:
We love to use our microphone to amplify the voices and insights gained to the broader Web3 ecosystem. Through our dedicated blog, we will focus on highlighting grant opportunities and deadlines while also including important network updates, we plan to start posting this much more regularly and hope our readership finds value in this information. Our video series, the Ecosystem Project Demo (EPD), will feature interviews with impactful public goods projects, showcasing their success stories and encouraging the community to support these initiatives. By bringing attention to the valuable work being done in the public goods space, we aim to highlight the value created by public goods and the outcomes they drive.  
In addition, we are very committed to keeping our community updated on the latest developments in the funding space. We have started this process by interviewing public goods projects like Octant as well to help the community gain visibility into new projects and mechanisms to support in the ecosystem.  By continuously monitoring trends, new opportunities, and funding initiatives, we will ensure that we provide the most relevant and timely information to the community. This approach will help participants stay informed about available grants and support, enhancing their engagement with the Web3 grants ecosystem. We will also leverage our social media platforms to actively share insights and updates.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: Please refer to https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/ethereum-cat-herders for latest update.

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: By sharing the same mission and supporting the public goods project in the ecosystem

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
**E**ducation, **C**ommunity Building & **H**omesteading the Ethereum ecosystem are at the heart of what we do at Ethereum Cat Herders (ECH). 

Through initiatives like [EIP Editing Office Hour](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqnDHxOyuwMpyt5s8F8gdmO), we actively engage with the community to encourage the documentation of Ethereum standards. With [PEEPanEIP](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F) and [EPD](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs), we keep the community informed about the latest developments in Protocol and Application updates. ECH is dedicated to fostering a well-informed and cohesive community, fully aligned with the Octant ecosystem's focus on education and community building.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Ethereum Cat Herders (ECH) is committed to supporting Ethereum's Core Protocol upgrades and improving the EIP process, alongside creating educational content. As part of our long-term roadmap, we will continue to actively contribute to protocol development, ensuring the sustained growth and evolution of the Ethereum ecosystem.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation: The Ethereum Cat Herders (ECH) team is a diverse group of contributors who bring a wide range of expertise to support the entire ecosystem. We have two EIP Editors on board to review incoming proposals, produce educational podcasts to keep the community informed about EIPs, and maintain a [website](https://www.ethcatherders.com/upgrades/pectra) that provides the latest updates on upcoming network upgrades.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: By supporting Ethereum Cat Herders, the community is putting their donations to be used for Education and continued support to the Ethereum Blockchain.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation: We talk about other [public goods projects](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5UktIsBAcvM&list=PL4cwHXAawZxr020waJCI0dZAfPAW2naK1&index=2&pp=gAQBiAQB) in different [community](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxr020waJCI0dZAfPAW2naK1) forums to create a supportive environment for new and existing projects.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: We'll continue to produce quality content on EIPs with [PEEPanEIP](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F) and bring other public goods projects to the community with [Ecosystem Project Demo](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs)

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation:
We produced multiple episodes on Gitcoin & Octant (video and podcast) sharing about the working of public goods grants and Governance in Octant.

data.title: Octant - Epoch 5

data.text:
# ECH Q4-2024: Updates & Roadmap

Dear Community,

We sincerely appreciate your ongoing support for [Ethereum Cat Herders](https://www.ethcatherders.com/).

In the past quarter, we have received 15.7321 ETH from Octant Epoch 5. These funds have been instrumental in supporting our continued efforts in protocol support, the creation of educational content, funding core devs meetings' notes bounties, EIP editors and other contributors. Additionally, we successfully hosted several events to showcase our work during DEVCON7 and EthSingapore 2024. Details are shared below.


## Deliverables

### 1. Educational Content Creation

#### [PEEPanEIP](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F)

Description: As part of our ongoing work to create informational content, we have recorded 2 new videos.

- [Prague-Electra Devnet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iXWmHNtQnoE&list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F&index=1&t=822s) We hosted Parithosh and Mario to talk about the Pectra testing needs for the respective execution and Consensus client layers for the [Pectra upgrade](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqOHV_F40AJbzcl8b6tG8xw), which is the most impactful fork to the EVM yet. The presentation covered [EIP-2537](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2537), [EIP-2935](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2935), [EIP-6110](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6110), [EIP-7002](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7002), [EIP-7251](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7251), [EIP-7685](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7685) and [EIP-7702](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7702). Interested readers can find specific information about the tests and precompiles [here](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1zGLXgYWbV1LQ-8rTDmaiSd534Lz2EOaT/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=110376681359606875330&rtpof=true&sd=true).

-  [Enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wo7IEUCGRxU&list=PL4cwHXAawZxqu0PKKyMzG_3BJV_xZTi1F&index=2) We hosted Potuz and Terence to share their progress on the draft [EIP-7732](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7732) that proposes a different method where an Ethereum block is validated.

These contents are also available on [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/7dgxKMkSyy3HWtQW7OfqXA?si=505147eee1ba4f76) as podcasts.

#### [Ecosystem Project Demo](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs)

Description: Through this series, we engage with builders by offering a platform to showcase overviews and live demonstrations of various tools, infrastructure, and applications within the Ethereum ecosystem. We produced 2 new episodes.

* [Ethereum Follow Protocol](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gW_Gu8xFRTo&list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs&index=2) We invited Brantly to introduce Ethereum Follow Protocol, an on-chain social graph protocol for Ethereum accounts.
* [Dappnode](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHpUus2NAc0&list=PL4cwHXAawZxrhbMXuCqMsCiwx1lwu_cNs&index=1) Pol Lanski shared how people can run validators and other nodes and earn rewards on Dappnode. He also shared alpha about AI integration and upcoming feature changes.

Like the PEEPanEIP series, these contents are also available on [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/7dgxKMkSyy3HWtQW7OfqXA?si=505147eee1ba4f76) as podcasts.

### 2. [Process Improvement](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxpLrRIkDlBjDUUrGgF91pQw) & Community Building

#### [EIP Office Hours](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqnDHxOyuwMpyt5s8F8gdmO) & [EIPIP Meetings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxpLrRIkDlBjDUUrGgF91pQw)

Description: We continued to host our fortnightly EIP Editing Office Hours to review draft EIPs, discuss any challenges, roadblocks or questions relating to EIPs and provide assistance to EIP drafters. Interested attendees can add agenda items, including seeking assistance for a draft proposal, by creating an issue on our [Github repository](https://github.com/ethcatherders/EIPIP). 5 EIP Editing Office Hours and 3 EIPIP Meetings recorded, available on Youtube.

### 3. [Network Upgrade Coordination ](https://www.ethcatherders.com/upgrades/pectra) and [Protocol Support](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/tree/master/Breakout-Room-Meetings)

Description: This deliverable covers the coordination and communication efforts for Ethereum network upgrades. It includes organizing meetings between core developers, documenting notes, making available meeting recordings to the community and ensuring that information is accessible to all. 13 podcast episodes (7 Consensus Layer Meetings, 6 Execution Layer Meetings), available on [different podcast platforms](https://www.ethcatherders.com/podcast).

Also extended support to:

* [All Wallet Devs meetings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4cwHXAawZxqn-kIc5VoOZv-esk9OiNSZ) (1 new recordings)
* [ePBS Implementers Meetings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJqWcTqh_zKHoz9dnQFGrWI_s1-8RwMhX) (7 new videos)
* [EOF Implementers meetings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJqWcTqh_zKHu7Z91YVYWy_PSmOc_66-F)  (8 new recordings)
* [eth_multicall meetings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJqWcTqh_zKECphjT_m7LVH4tusTtvory) (9 new recordings)

These and other Breakout Room Meetings are now available on [ethereum/pm GitHub](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/tree/master/Breakout-Room-Meetings) for easier access. This also includes notes for [Breakout Room Meetings at Devcon SEA](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/tree/master/Breakout-Room-Meetings/DevconSEA).

## Milestones

Thanks to the funding made available, we were able to travel to Singapore and to Thailand to attend and co-host WiEP events during the Ethereum Singapore 2024 and DEVCON7. We were also able to produce swags such as T-shirts, stickers and flyers to promote Ethereum Cat Herders and our work to the community. We're able to increase our presence through event hosting & participation.


### Eth Singapore 2024
* Ethereum Cat Herders joined the [Ethereum Singapore Week 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v9G684uz6Rk) held at the Art Science Museum, highlighting the organization’s contributions to the Ethereum community.

* Pooja Ranjan had a [fireside chat](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/pooja-r-072899114_ethsingapore-intheetherasm-vitalikbuterin-activity-7244181702288322563-uT-e?utm_source=share) with [Aya Miyaguchi,](https://x.com/AyaMiyagotchi) Executive Director of [Ethereum Foundation](https://x.com/ethereum), discussing leadership and ecosystem development.[ Event details](https://lu.ma/zcy4q2yq?tk=8nBtAZ)

* Also, delivered a talk titled "[ECH Contributing to Ethereum's Infinite Garden](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfr1UykhQj8&list=PLR0c7ZvtTHE-GHxWnDXAlFT2WTzsOzpKZ&index=25)" during the Ethereum Singapore: Infinite Garden City Comes Alive event, showcasing the entity’s role in fostering the Ethereum ecosystem.


### Devcon SEA
* Chief Herder, Pooja, delivered a talk “[EIPs Simplified: History and Process Explained](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xycI1vbxJo8)”, educating attendees on Ethereum Improvement Proposals and their significance to DEVCON participants.

* Secured an [ Impact Booth](https://youtu.be/4dDRregPXcU) for Ethereum Cat Herders at Devcon 7, Bangkok 2024, which attracted over 230 attendees, significantly raising the entity's visibility and impact.[ Event details](https://lu.ma/2q0wpfe4).

* Co-hosted [Women in Ethereum Protocol (WiEP) Brunch & Networking @Devcon](https://lu.ma/b2bdsuke?tk=a4jeK5), connecting with women who are in the ecosystem or want to be part of the ecosystem. 
  * [Women Leading the Future of Ethereum | WiEP Overview by Pooja Ranjan & La Donna Higgins](https://youtu.be/idMUzYquvB8).
  * Success stories of cohorts of [WiEP Study Group & Insights](https://youtu.be/5gWbu8lbFMA) and [Adventure into the Ethereum Ecosystem ](https://youtu.be/wQ2RqrAFxG8) with Sandra Johnson.
* Supported [Women in Web3 World Hub - Devcon ](https://lu.ma/13y7x8sn?tk=6pgNF0) event. 
  * [Empowering Women in Ethereum: WiEP Introduction ](https://youtu.be/C_zkU-f4tto)  ft. La Donna & Pooja @ W3 Hub
  * Pooja delivered another talk on [Shaping Ethereum’s Protocol Governance & Decision Making](https://youtu.be/U_UN8FRqi5c).

Through Devcon, we successfully grew our Discord community by 108 new members and collected nearly 100 survey responses from the community. These responses provided valuable insights into the types of educational content they would like to see and feedback on how we can improve our efforts.

Additionally, we received inquiries and messages from community members expressing interest in volunteering with us.

### Q1-2025 Plans 
Beyond our ongoing initiatives, we plan 
- to create a platform to recognize EIP authors (whose EIPs are included) by awarding them NFTs to commemorate their contributions to Ethereum Network Upgrade. Our team is actively developing the user interface to enable the distribution of NFT with the upcoming Pectra network upgrade.

- Additionally, we aim to onboard a Community Coordinator to expand the reach of Ethereum Cat Herders within the Ethereum ecosystem. 

* **Expected Outcome**: Celebrating EIP Authors & increased community interaction. 
 

# Education * Community Building * Homesteading Ethereum
data.title: ECH Q4-2024: Updates & Roadmap

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

[Ethereum Cat Herders](https://www.ethcatherders.com/) is a public good initiative dedicated to strengthening the Ethereum ecosystem through education, community engagement, and coordination. The team supports smooth network upgrades by managing EIP processes, documenting proposals, creating educational content, and promoting knowledge sharing. Our efforts aim to foster a well-informed, cohesive Ethereum community. Read more about our support in [Ethereum Cat Herders’ Wrap for 2024](https://medium.com/ethereum-cat-herders/ethereum-cat-herders-wrap-for-2024-62b029f1dcee)

# Education * Community Building * Homesteading Ethereum
data.title: Octant Epoch 6

milestones.title: NFT Recognition for EIP Authors of Pectra Upgrade
milestones.description: Our development team is building a platform to recognize and celebrate EIP authors whose proposals are included in Ethereum network upgrades. To commemorate their contributions, we will award them NFTs. The team is currently designing the user interface to facilitate the distribution of these NFTs, which is aligned with the upcoming Pectra network upgrade.

milestones.title: EIP Editors' Workshop
milestones.description: We are hosting the first formal [EIP Editors' Workshop](https://github.com/ethcatherders/EIPIP/issues/372) of 2025, designed to onboard new reviewers and editors to strengthen the EIP process. This workshop aims to support the growing influx of pull requests (PRs) across various Ethereum standard repositories, ensuring efficient review and management.

What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
What is the long-term impact of your grant?

How will the grant funds be used?

data.fundUsage: In addition to our ongoing efforts, which include scheduling Ethereum developers' meetings, managing recordings, documenting [notes](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/tree/master/Breakout-Room-Meetings), network upgrade information sharing through the [website](https://www.ethcatherders.com/upgrades/pectra) and producing [video](https://www.youtube.com/@ethcatherders/podcasts) and [audio](https://www.ethcatherders.com/podcast) podcasts, we plan to allocate funds toward achieving this new milestone.

data.title: Launch of WiEP Study Group (Cohort 3)
data.description:
We are excited to kick off [Cohort 3](https://github.com/wiepteam/studygroup/tree/main/Cohort%203) of the [Women in Ethereum Protocol (WiEP) Study Group](https://github.com/wiepteam/studygroup), a learning initiative focused on onboarding and empowering participants to engage with the Ethereum protocol at a deeper level. This cohort will provide structured educational sessions covering Ethereum fundamentals, key protocol components, and improvement processes such as EIPs (Ethereum Improvement Proposals).

Participants will gain hands-on experience navigating Ethereum’s open-source repositories and be supported in making their **first pull request (PR)** to the official Ethereum GitHub organization. By the end of the cohort, participants will have foundational knowledge of Ethereum’s architecture, improved confidence in contributing to protocol discussions, and direct experience with open-source collaboration.

data.title: NFT Recognition for EIP Authors of Pectra Upgrade
data.description: Our development team is building a platform to recognize and celebrate EIP authors whose proposals are included in Ethereum network upgrades. To commemorate their contributions, we will award them NFTs. The team is currently designing the user interface to facilitate the distribution of these NFTs, which is aligned with the upcoming Pectra network upgrade.

data.title: EIP Editors' Workshop
data.description: We are hosting the first formal [EIP Editors' Workshop](https://github.com/ethcatherders/EIPIP/issues/372) of 2025, designed to onboard new reviewers and editors to strengthen the EIP process. This workshop aims to support the growing influx of pull requests (PRs) across various Ethereum standard repositories, ensuring efficient review and management.

data.reason:
We successfully hosted the first [EIP Editors’ Workshop](https://github.com/ethcatherders/EIPIP/issues/372), aimed at onboarding new reviewers and editors to support the growing volume of Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) across standard repositories. The session offered in-depth guidance on the EIP process, roles, expectations, and best practices for reviewing proposals, drawing from key documents like [EIP-1](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1), [EIP-5069](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5069), and [editor onboarding guides](https://hackmd.io/@poojaranjan/EIPEditorOnboarding). The workshop emphasized collaboration, technical accuracy, and editorial quality in EIP reviews, with contributions from long-standing editors and community members. A recording and resource deck were shared to ensure ongoing access to materials and encourage broader participation.

Following the workshop, we observed a noticeable uptick in reviewer contributions from both seasoned developers and new community members. Over the last three months, more than 50 EIP reviews were conducted, with over 30 PRs merged and 15 active proposals under review. Contributors such as [Jochem Brouwer](https://x.com/JochemBrouwer96), [Marchhill](https://x.com/marchhill1), Advaita Saha, and others played key roles in reviewing Core EIPs, ERC standards, and Execution Layer proposals. This momentum reinforces the importance of growing our reviewer base to reduce backlog and improve review quality. Looking ahead, we plan to refine KPIs to track reviewer performance, streamline onboarding, and scale review efforts—ensuring the EIP process remains robust and community-driven.

We successfully hosted the first [EIP Editors’ Workshop](https://github.com/ethcatherders/EIPIP/issues/372), aimed at onboarding new reviewers and editors to support the growing volume of Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) across standard repositories. The session offered in-depth guidance on the EIP process, roles, expectations, and best practices for reviewing proposals, drawing from key documents like [EIP-1](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1), [EIP-5069](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5069), and [editor onboarding guides](https://hackmd.io/@poojaranjan/EIPEditorOnboarding). The workshop emphasized collaboration, technical accuracy, and editorial quality in EIP reviews, with contributions from long-standing editors and community members. A recording and resource deck were shared to ensure ongoing access to materials and encourage broader participation.

Following the workshop, we observed a noticeable uptick in reviewer contributions from both seasoned developers and new community members. Over the last three months, more than 50 EIP reviews were conducted, with over 30 PRs merged and 15 active proposals under review. Contributors such as [Jochem Brouwer](https://x.com/JochemBrouwer96), [Marchhill](https://x.com/marchhill1), Advaita Saha, and others played key roles in reviewing Core EIPs, ERC standards, and Execution Layer proposals. This momentum reinforces the importance of growing our reviewer base to reduce backlog and improve review quality. Looking ahead, we plan to refine KPIs to track reviewer performance, streamline onboarding, and scale review efforts—ensuring the EIP process remains robust and community-driven.

questions.explanation: https://dsc.gg/ech

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: We participated in the GG21 round.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
We are the **coordination layer** between consensus and execution clients, core Ethereum protocol developers, researchers and open-sourced contributors. We help the growth of the OSS system by ensuring that anyone who wants to improve Ethereum mainnet can do so with minimum barriers. 🚀


**📓EIP Process Facilitation & Coordination**

Our Github repository lets Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) writers to seek help from EIP Editors who are experienced core developers. 

They are able to create an issue on ECH’s Github repository or add their EIP as an agenda item for ECH’s fortnightly EIP office hours discussions. As shepherds of the EIP process, we help support EIP and ERC writers by having our editors review their proposals live and give feedback. We also actively monitor PRs to move proposals along the process so that the community can discuss their merits and whether to schedule it for inclusion in mainnet upgrade. 

To date, we have hosted and recorded:
👉 114 EIP Improvement Process (EIPIP) meetings  
👉 56 EIP Editing Office Hours.

We also host **EIP Editors’ Workshops** designed to onboard new reviewers and editors to support the increase in pull requests from various Ethereum standard repositories, ensuring efficient review and management.


**🎥EIP education content, PEEPanEIP and Ecosystem Project Demo Podcasts**

We produce and publish podcasts on Youtube and Spotify. Through PEEPanEIP, we help break down technical concepts of EIPs for community members and implementers. PEEPanEIP episodes also include proposals that are scheduled for inclusion in the upcoming network upgrades. These efforts grow the OSS ecosystem as it encourages the community to contribute directly to Ethereum mainnet upgrades. 

We also feature open-sourced Ecosystem Projects such as Open Source Observer, Karma GAP and more. We help promote the work of open-source builders and encourage more people to build OSS and grow the OSS ecosystem. 

**🔎One-stop portal for network upgrades, protocol call notes and other resources**

Our website is  a one-stop application for anyone who is interested in Ethereum core development and upcoming network upgrades. 

We provide protocol meetings notes documented by ECH community members, proposals related to network upgrades and educational resources that we develop for EIPs in each network upgrade and links to our podcasts. Our website is open-sourced and anyone can contribute to the maintenance of the website, through making a pull request. We ensure that our community members can participate in and stay updated with the happenings of the open-sourced Ethereum ecosystem.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
**✨NFT attestation for EIP authors**

We have rolled out an NFT attestation for EIP authors for the Pectra network upgrade, which is unique and not found in other projects. The Github repository for this feature is open-sourced. The NFT attestation is a way of encouraging and showing appreciation to EIP authors who have contributed to scaling Ethereum/ making Ethereum more decentralized and secure.

**⚒️EIP process management**

Our Github repository is a decentralized process management system where EIP editors and reviewers work together asynchronously to provide feedback to authors and move along pull requests. 

To date, our EIP editors and reviewers have collectively closed **2037 EIP-related pull requests**, **553 ERC-related pull requests** and **45 RIP-related pull requests.** 🚀

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
**🌱 Development of community dashboard**

We plan to use the grant funds to develop more features for our project. For instance, the development of a community dashboard on our website. This is to allow community members or core developers to upload and share their notes documented in any Ethereum Protocol Calendar meetings. This will help other community members get up-to-date information in one place.


**🎞️Produce more EIP and EPD podcasts for the community**

We further plan to use the funds for the production of more EIPs and Ecosystem Projects podcasts on Youtube and Spotify. We aim to produce and publish at least 48 PEEPanEIP videos and Ecosystem Project Demos to highlight useful open-sourced toolings and infrastructure in the ecosystem.
